info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 7:42PM MST until August 11 at 9:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 742 PM MST, Doppler radar showed only light rain still falling over the southern end of the Hualapai Mountains. However, very heavy rain fell earlier, and the water could still be flowing over Alamo Road. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Mohave County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
